channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ソーステンセント・ミュージック、ネットイースのクラウド・ミュージックなど、中国のオンライン賭博取り締まりを受け、多額のコストをかけて仮想福引などのストリーミング機能を削減（Josh Ye/Reuters）
item.description:
Josh Ye / Reuters:
Source: Tencent Music, NetEase's Cloud Music, and others cut streaming features like virtual lucky draws at a hefty cost, amid China's online gambling crackdown  —  Chinese online content platforms including Tencent Music (1698.HK) and NetEase's Cloud Music (9899.HK) have removed live streaming features …

item.title: YouTubeは、Shortsのアルゴリズムと長編のYouTubeのアルゴリズムとの違いや、何をビューとしてカウントするかなど、Shortsクリエイターを導くための洞察を提供している（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）。
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
YouTube offers insights meant to guide Shorts creators, including how the Shorts algorithm differs from long-form YouTube's algorithm and what counts as a view  —  YouTube this week put out a new video meant to address creators' questions over its short-form video platform, YouTube Shorts.

item.title: インドによるカシミール・ワラのウェブサイト閉鎖、メディアをPRに変えようとする政府の動きなどについて、Kashmir Times編集長アヌラーダ・バシンとのQ&A（Raksha Kumar/Reuters Institute）
item.description:
Raksha Kumar / Reuters Institute:
Q&A with Kashmir Times Executive Editor Anuradha Bhasin on India blocking The Kashmir Walla's website, the government's push to turn the media into PR, and more  —  “The message is for all journalists in India.  As long as you are toeing the government's line, you will be fine," says Anuradha Bhasin

item.title: コンテンツモデレーション戦争で打撃を受けたメタとユーチューブが、Xに続いて政治的誤報の取り締まりから撤退し、2024年の米選挙への不安を高めている（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
How Meta and YouTube, battered by content moderation wars, are following X in retreating from policing political misinformation, raising US 2024 election fears  —  Facebook and YouTube are receding from their role as watchdogs against conspiracy theories ahead of the 2024 presidential election

item.title: スティーヴン・キングは、自分の本がAIのトレーニングに使われることについて考察している。
item.description:
Stephen King / The Atlantic:
Stephen King reflects on his books being used for AI training, arguing the sum is lesser than its parts, so far, as creativity can't happen without sentience  —  One prominent author responds to the revelation that his writing is being used to coach artificial intelligence.  —  Self-driving cars.

item.title: ネットフリックスは、9月29日にサービスを終了する前に、レンタル・バイ・メールの加入者にDVDまたはブルーレイディスクの最終ロットと最大10本の映画を提供する。
item.description:
Reggie Ugwu / New York Times:
Netflix offers its rental-by-mail subscribers their final batch of DVD or Blu-ray discs and up to 10 movies to keep before closing the service on September 29  —  The company is shuttering its rental-by-mail service in September, more than 25 years after it launched.

item.title: YouTubeは、2023年末までにクリエイターがRSSフィード経由でポッドキャストをアップロードできるようにし、2023年末までにさらに多くの国でYouTube Musicにポッドキャストを追加する計画だ（Ben Schoon/9to5Google）
item.description:
Ben Schoon / 9to5Google:
YouTube plans to let creators upload podcasts via an RSS feed by the end of 2023 and add podcasts to YouTube Music in more countries through the end of 2023  —  YouTube Music just launched support for podcasts earlier this year, and that's going to only get better in the months to come as RSS support is apparently coming to the app.

item.title: マリオン郡保安官事務所、警察がマリオン郡記録のコンピューターからコピーし、フラッシュドライブに違法に保存していたファイルの破棄に同意（Sherman Smith/Kansas Reflector）
item.description:
Sherman Smith / Kansas Reflector:
Marion County Sheriff's Office agrees to destroy the files that the police copied from the Marion County Record's computers and illegally kept on a flash drive  —  Marion County Record reporter Phyllis Zorn and Sheriff Jeff Soyez stand outside the evidence room where an undersheriff signs over newspaper property to a forensic expert.

item.title: 情報源：FBIとドイツの捜査当局は、2人のロシア人ジャーナリストと1人のロシア人活動家が毒殺された可能性について調査している（Jimmy Vielkind/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Jimmy Vielkind / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: the FBI and German investigators are probing the possible poisonings of two Russian journalists and a Russian activist  —  Three women say they suffered a sudden onset of unusual symptoms; FBI and German investigators conducting probes  —  The FBI and German investigators are probing …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙、CNN、ロイター通信などが、OpenAIのGPTBotウェブクローラーによるコンテンツへのアクセスをブロック。
item.description:
Ariel Bogle / The Guardian:
The New York Times, CNN, Reuters, and other outlets block OpenAI's GPTBot web crawler from accessing their content; some have also blocked Common Crawl's CCBot  —  Chicago Tribune and Australian newspapers the Canberra Times and Newcastle Herald also appear to have disallowed web crawler from maker of Chat GPT

item.title: YouTubeがNFLのサンデーチケットにクリエイターをどのように組み込むか。
item.description:
Ainsley Harris / Fast Company:
How YouTube plans to integrate creators into its NFL Sunday Ticket programming, as the company looks to be a “one-stop shop for multiple types of video content”  —  College football's brightest stars, dressed in their snappiest suits, assembled beneath gray skies and the beaux-arts grandeur …

item.title: ラジオ番組『Latino USA』やその他のラテン系コンテンツを制作する非営利団体フトゥーロ・メディアがレイオフを発表、「数ヶ月にわたる経済的不透明感」を理由に (@futuromedia)
item.description:
@futuromedia:
Futuro Media, a nonprofit that produces the radio show Latino USA and other Latino-focused content, announces layoffs, citing “months of economic uncertainty”  —  A Message from Futuro Media [image]

item.title: メモフィフス・シーズン（旧エンデバー・コンテンツ）が「AMPTPとWGAおよびSAG-AFTRAの間で係争が続いている」ことを理由に、スタッフの約12％に当たる30人を削減（ピーター・ホワイト／Deadline）。
item.description:
Peter White / Deadline:
Memo: Fifth Season, formerly known as Endeavor Content, cuts 30 jobs, or ~12% of its staff, citing “the ongoing dispute between the AMPTP and WGA & SAG-AFTRA”  —  - Martin Sheen Goes Full President Bartlet In Rousing Speech At National Day Of Solidarity Rally In LA As Kerry Washington & Ron Perlman Blast Studios

item.title: 情報筋アマゾンはディズニーとESPNのストリーミング版について初期段階から交渉しており、マイノリティ出資をしながら配信を手伝う可能性もある。
item.description:
Sahil Patel / The Information:
Sources: Amazon has had early talks with Disney about working on a streaming version of ESPN, possibly helping with distribution while taking a minority stake  —  Amazon has had early talks with Disney about working on the streaming version of ESPN it is developing, said people familiar with the matter.

item.title: YouTuberのJustine Ezarikと弁護士のPaige Kaplanが役員を務める非営利のアドボカシー団体「Creators Guild of America」が、クリエイターの利益を支援するためにデビュー（Kaya Yurieff/The Information）
item.description:
Kaya Yurieff / The Information:
The Creators Guild of America, a nonprofit advocacy group with YouTuber Justine Ezarik and lawyer Paige Kaplan on its board, debuts to back creators' interests  —  The Hollywood strike has highlighted the lack of a similar labor movement within the creator economy, but new efforts to change that are emerging.
